intro: Angolluma foetida, commonly known as the stinking weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields and along roadsides. Angolluma foetida is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
